DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective of this study is to estimate the distribution of pathogenic species and genotypes of bacterial diversity in 7 stages ICDAS (International Caries Detection and Assessment System) corresponding to the severity of dental caries among patients aged 3-45 years consulting in the Dentistry Departments of the NÃ®mes University Hospital and the Montpellier University Hospital.
DOC.brief_title: Pathogenic Species and Genotypes of Bacterial Diversity in Relation to the Severity of Dental Caries
DOC.detailed_description: Secondary objectives include: - Compare the distribution of bacterial species in relation to stages of severity of caries - Compare the results from plaque with those of saliva samples.
DOC.criteria: Volunteers aged 3 to 45 who come in to the hospital for a dental consultation Minors must have parental permission The patient must have given his/her informed and signed consent The patient is participating in another study The patient is in an exclusion period determined by a previous study The patient is pregnant, or breastfeeding The patient has been on antibiotics within the past two months Smokers Teeth under current care Parodontopathy Use of a mouthwash within the last week Insufficient numbers of healthy and/or teeth with carious lesions for carrying out the study
